oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Dr. Martin Luther King, The Shining Symbol of the Elks Scholarship Program"
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: civil rights; Lee, George W.; King, Martin Luther, Jr.; speeches;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Speech delivered in Saginaw, Michigan, on July 21, 1968, discussing the history of the civil rights movement and the success of the Elks scholarship program. Contains handwritten notes on back of page 16.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lee, George W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Manuscript collection processed by Mary B. Clark
